column4: hello guys if I want to run anything in the shell is it always this command "sudo ./filename"
why do i always need to type sudo if i am logged in as admin???
just find it annoying typing in password everytime
oh, well it is this program sudo ./vmware-install.pl
yes, you will need to be sudo for that
how often are you running that where it is an inconvienience
can i edit it if i wanted?
is so awesome, i can edit everrything
so how would i go about modding the core files of ubuntu???
you can edit everything in any OS...don't know what you are meaning
u just said that one can edit any OS, how would i edit windows? I cant its not open source?
I meant that you can edit any program in any OS, you are talking now about something different.
Its like changing the pipelines and max connection in firefox, you cannot do that in Internet explorer
